title: Chapter 867
content:
[★Hidden Quest★ 'Vatican Invasion' has been abandoned.]
[Affinity with the Yatan Church has decreased by 100.]
[The relationship with the Yatan Church has changed from friendly to wary.]

The Vatican Invasion—a hidden quest boasting tremendous rewards and the near-certainty of triggering a major story arc. Yet Agnus was throwing it all away. Walking away from the prize that had been within his grasp.

It was madness beyond comprehension.

"You're insane!" Rose's scream tore through the chaos. But it was already too late to stop him.

Lich Mumud crashed into Silvenas, and Agnus shot through the opening, closing the distance to Irene in a heartbeat.

"Agnus...!" Coke's voice trembled.

The Mad Dog himself. The lunatic everyone feared. Now he was barreling toward the queen and prince. Coke had no way of knowing Agnus had just saved them from Silvenas' lethal scream. All he could do was grip his sword with shaking hands, a boy determined to protect someone despite his weakness.

The sight struck something deep in Agnus. His eyes flashed with raw emotion.

The memory surfaced unbidden—of his own helpless past, when he couldn't protect the woman he loved. Regret. Rage. Resentment. Grief. All of it twisted across Agnus' face in a terrible expression that evoked more sympathy than fear.

"Who are you?" the little prince asked, his voice soft. Even in his fear, he recognized the sorrow etched into the face of the man now standing between them and danger.

Agnus barely suppressed the fury roiling inside him. "Just a fool."

"..."

What else could he call himself? Obsessed with a past that could never be changed, creating fresh regrets in the present moment. A fool—that's what he was. Agnus knew with crystal clarity that abandoning this quest for old memories was irrational. He knew he'd regret it.

Yet here he was.

And Yatan's Third Servant Aliburn was making sure he understood the consequences.

"Baal's Contractor!" Aliburn's voice shook with fury. "Have you forgotten the grace we showed you by granting the Stone of Life? You will regret this betrayal!" His rage stemmed from misunderstanding—he couldn't fathom why Baal's Contractor would turn on the Yatan Church. "It's always the same with Baal's Contractors! Always interfering with us!"

The Yatan Church served the evil god Yatan, and the great demons were Yatan's children. By rights, Baal—the 1st Great Demon—should have been second only to Yatan himself in the servants' devotion. But Baal had always been incomprehensible. Centuries ago, he'd contracted with the legendary Pagma, granting him tremendous power that had been used to interfere with demonic descents. It had seemed like a whim then, but now Aliburn was forced to question Baal's true intentions.

"Baal seeks to betray God Yatan!" There was no limit to a great demon's ambition. Clearly, Baal intended to overthrow Yatan and claim godhood for himself.

Agnus laughed. "That bastard's intentions don't concern me."

"What? You...?"

"I am me. Did you think I'd dance to someone else's tune? Kik!" Agnus didn't care if this was the wrong choice. He gestured toward Coke and Irene. "I want to save these people. That's the only desire in my heart."

To Irene and Lord, he appeared as a heaven-sent savior. Yet Coke remained wary, uncertain.

Aliburn stared at Agnus, momentarily speechless. Then he made his threat explicit. "Someday, your current strength won't be enough to protect them. You will fall, and they will die."

"..."

"And then the Stone of Life will be taken from you."

This was Agnus' final chance.

"Wake up. Change your mind." Aliburn extended his hand.

A notification window materialized before Agnus, asking once more if he wished to accept the Vatican Invasion hidden quest. Once again, the rewards were staggering—massive gains to demonic power, intelligence, and dominance, plus 50% resistance to divine attacks. Quest rewards perfectly tailored to maximize Baal's Contractor's strengths while covering his weaknesses.

A temptation no sane person could refuse. Unless they were a fool...

And Agnus was a fool.

"I'm still going to fight. Kik!"

His desires had never aligned with those of ordinary people. He didn't crave strength, power, or wealth. He only wanted to reclaim what he'd lost. That's why he couldn't turn away from this scene—couldn't ignore these people—even if new regrets would join the old. His past wouldn't allow it.

[★Hidden Quest★ 'Vatican Invasion' has been rejected.]
[Yatan's Third Servant Aliburn is extremely angry.]
[The relationship with the Yatan Church has changed from wary to hostile.]
[The hidden class quest 'Will of the Former Generation' has been opened!]

[Will of the Former Generation]
[Difficulty: Class Quest.
You have made an enemy of the Yatan Church. This means you will face God Yatan and all great demons as adversaries.
You have chosen the same path as Pagma, the former Baal's Contractor.
Go to the Hall of Fame!
Understand Pagma's will!
Glimpse the legacy and power he left behind, and prepare to battle the great demons!
Quest Clear Conditions: Overcome the trials that await in the Hall of Fame.
Quest Clear Reward: Baal's Contractor will inherit a portion of Pagma's power.
Quest Failure: Rewards will be permanently lost.]

Connected to Pagma? This unexpected development piqued Agnus' interest. One of the Five Miracles had once again defied Morpheus' predictions.

"Kik!" Agnus burst into laughter.

"Yes! This is exactly what Baal's Contractor does!" Aliburn roared. The magic power he'd accumulated by absorbing divine energy roiled through the ground. But Agnus met it without fear.

"Summon! Death Knight!"

Lich Mumud entangled Silvenas as death knights erupted from the earth.

"Furfu's Power!"

White light flooded the stormy night sky. The torrential rain froze mid-fall. This was the might of Great Demon Furfu, channeled through Agnus' hands to empower all his servants—demons, death knights, and Lich Mumud alike.

Silvenas had been holding her own against Mumud's prismatic magic, but now—"Kyaaak!" She screamed as the empowered Lich overwhelmed her.

The strengthened Mumud alone was threatening Yatan's Fourth Servant. Now that Agnus had crossed the point of no return, Aliburn's eyes burned crimson. "You...!"

His infinite pride as the continent's greatest black magician shattered.

"Let unclean darkness spread! Let the sky and earth be corrupted!"

The sky, bleached white by Furfu's Power, darkened once more. Heavy rain fell invisible through the gloom as curses of every kind filled the air. Those present trembled in terror.

"Do as you will!" At that moment, the elders who'd been working to break Pope Damian's barrier unleashed Goddess' Purification. With their high dark resistance, Aliburn's Mana Burn couldn't touch them. The divine light from all thirteen of them cleansed the polluted sky and earth in an instant.

"I'll have to handle this myself." The silent 2nd Prince of the Saharan Empire manifested his red energy. His blade, wrapped in that crimson power, cut down dozens of black magicians in a single strike.

"What?" Yatan's Sixth Servant Cardiora's eyes widened. She'd been engaged with the solo number knights escorting the prince—she never imagined the greenhouse-raised imperial prince concealed such devastating strength. Cardiora wasn't alone in her shock. Kasim, flying in to strike at Aliburn, and everyone else in the banquet hall gaped at Dulandal's display.

'This cursed power!' Kasim, of course, knew about the royal family's red energy. How could he forget? That same energy had annihilated his entire clan.

The battlefield lines were drawn: Silvenas pinned down by Agnus. Rose facing Chucksley and Isabel. Aliburn battling the elders and Rebecca's Daughters. Cardiora engaged with the Red Knights and Dulandal. The black magicians holding back knights from other kingdoms and the Rebecca's Daughter candidates.

Agnus' betrayal and Dulandal's hidden power—two variables the Yatan Church hadn't accounted for. The situation was turning against them.

'There's hope!' The gathered royalty, blessed with keen insight, felt their spirits lift. If they cooperated and fought hard, they could overcome this crisis. Survive. With renewed determination, they led their knights to cut down the black magicians as quickly as possible.

Then Yatan's Seventh Servant Hill reversed everything. Despair crashed over them as the rotund middle-aged man emerged from wherever he'd been hiding since the battle began.

"Hehe! Kihehe! Aliburn! I've succeeded!" Hill laughed, brandishing a sword embedded in a chunk of stone. The trapped Pope Damian, the elders, Rebecca's Daughters—all stared in horror. The Holy Sword gifted to the first pope by Goddess Rebecca herself was now in the Yatan Church's hands.

A new quest forced itself upon Damian.

[Recapture the Holy Sword]
[The Sealed Holy Sword, bestowed upon the first pope by the goddess, has fallen into the hands of the Yatan Church!
The Holy Sword is Rebecca's symbol and proof of the papacy!
You must retrieve it!
Quest Clear Conditions: Reclaim the Sealed Holy Sword.
Quest Clear Reward: Goddess Rebecca's blessing. Affinity with the elders will reach maximum. All believers will revere you.
Quest Failure: Many believers will lose faith in the church's ineffective leadership and abandon it. You will lose eligibility to serve as pope. Goddess Rebecca will be disappointed. Level -5.]

What could he possibly do trapped behind this barrier? In the midst of crisis, Damian prayed desperately for salvation. But Goddess Rebecca remained silent.

"Ungh...!" Despite his anxiety, Damian's gaze remained fixed on Isabel and Irene. He prayed for the safety of the woman he loved and everyone precious to him. How much longer could they hold out?

As Aliburn began cursing the Holy Sword, the Rebecca priests, paladins, elders, and daughters all felt their divine power beginning to drain away.
